Community gardens: Neighbors could come together to start and maintain shared gardens, growing their own food and sharing what they have with others.
Foraging: People could learn to identify edible plants and fungi in their local environment, and forage for food when supermarkets are inaccessible.
Mobile markets: A group of farmers and food truck owners could come together to offer a mobile food market that travels to different neighborhoods, providing access to fresh food.
Home gardens: People could start their own home gardens, growing a variety of vegetables, fruits, and herbs to sustain themselves.
Food sharing platforms: These platforms would allow people to share excess food they have grown or received as gifts with others in need.
